issues.title: Thomas’s WGLC review
issues.author: thomas-fossati
issues.body:
Archived-at: https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/rats/zZIPbD5Erq3an-j9OrOPA-amgxM/

## Abstract

* [x] "this document provides the methods and means to define additional
  Event Streams for other Conceptual Messages"
  * [x] Which "methods and means" are provided?  I have read the whole
    document but I didn’t find them.
  * [x] Like ReIM, this document seems to suffer from an "unlimited scope"
    problem. IMO, too much emphasis is placed on the idea that the
    interaction can be generalised to other CMs. This seems an even
    more radical assumption here because, unlike ReIM, this
    specification provides a real wire protocol rather than a set of
    interaction models.  As such, it should clearly explain how this
    idea is realised.

* [x] Ignorant question: What does "providing the same protected
  capabilities as TPMs" mean concretely?  Would a DICE RoT be considered
  equivalent?

## §1

* [x] s/Conceptional/Conceptual/ :-)

* [x] "[RFC9683] and [RFC9684] define the operational prerequisites and a
  YANG Model for the acquisition of Evidence and other Conceptional
  Messages [...]"
  * [x] Skimming RFC968[34], there is no mention of "other conceptual
    messages"; the scope seems to be quite rigidly confined to
    attestation evidence.

* [x] In general, whenever citing ReIM, 9334, etc. increase precision: use
  "Section X of Y" whenever possible.

* [x] "This memo specifies a YANG augment"
  * [x] "augment" is the concrete YANG statement... in this context
    "augmentation" may be more appropriate.

* [x] "or its [the nonce’s] freshness characteristics."
  * [x] Unclear what "freshness characteristics" is supposed to mean.
    Please could you clarify?

* [x] "Two complementary methods [...]"
  * [x] Is "complementary" the right word? Are they supposed to be used
    together?  If not, use "alternative methods" instead?

* [x] "In consequence, in some usage scenarios the timing considerations for
  freshness [RFC9334] might have to be updated in some regular interval.
  Analogously, there are can be additional methods that are not describe
  by but nevertheless supported by this document."
  * [x] The grammar seems a be buggy.  It's unclear to me what this
    paragraph is supposed to mean.

## §3.1

Similar to reading a QFT textbook, I approached this section with my
heart filled with expectation of enlightment, but I only found more
confusion ;-)

* [x] The sequence diagram needs some attention: a diagram should be
self-explanatory, but parameter names appear and disappear from one
message to the next.  This lack of correlation makes it impossible to
follow without referring to the subsequent prose.
It's not a fatal flaw, but it's still slightly annoying. ;-)

* [x] "a set of PCRs of interest which the wants to appraise"
  * add "[...] the RP/Verifier wants [...]"

* [x] "a handle (see Section 6. in
  [I-D.ietf-rats-reference-interaction-models], which is either the
  initially received nonce or a more recently received Epoch ID"
  * Not sure how "a more recently received Epoch ID" is conveyed?
  * Also, the use of parentheses is broken in this bullet point

* [x] "is elaborated on in the follow section Section 3.2."
  * remove "follow section"

* [x] unclear what "acquire a new time synchronisation" means.  Please
  rephrase using simpler terms.

## §3.2.2

* [x] s/countersr/counters/

## §4.3.1

* [x] s/emmitted/emitted/

## §4.5

* [x] The reference [KGV] doesn't seem to make sense

## §8

* [x] The security considerations look very (too?) thin.  While it's great to
refer to the baseline specs, it seems odd that no further security
considerations are introduced by this augmentation.  For example, the
freshness-related aspects covered in §3.2 seem relevant to security, yet
they are not mentioned at all (not even by reference).  In particular,
correctly sizing the heartbeat would seem an interesting topic to
explore.
You may also wish to discuss the attack surface that is potentially
enabled in a pub-sub scope, e.g.:
  * [x] DoS the node via oversubscription/resource exhaustion
  * [x] Amplification attacks (AFAIU, the notifications include an
    ever-increasing event log (§3.1 says: "log entries [...] since
    boot")

## Final words

* [ ] One final consideration is that the document would benefit from a
back-to-back edit to improve its readability, including the prose and
diagrams.

comments.author: henkbirkholz
comments.body:
> Ignorant question: What does "providing the same protected
capabilities as TPMs" mean concretely? Would a DICE RoT be considered
equivalent?

I think not, probably a subset.
But maybe we can figure this out. A TPM-equivalent has various protected capabilities, e.g., storing shielded secrets that can only be operated on and to provide integrity registers (the TPM's PCRs). My assumption is that RFC9684 and this I-D can be adapted to support DICE, but it is not in the current scope and both phrasing as well as data structures are tailored towards TPMs.

comments.author: henkbirkholz
comments.body:
> Not sure how "a more recently received Epoch ID" is conveyed?

By the methods described in Section 3.2 directly below (or by re-establishing a subscription via a new subscription request, which 3.2 helps to avoid).

comments.author: henkbirkholz
comments.body:
> The reference [KGV] doesn't seem to make sense to me

2.3.2 in that reference wouldn't work? We could all back to something else. Let's figure this out.

comments.author: henkbirkholz
comments.body: Protected Capability is defined in: https://trustedcomputinggroup.org/wp-content/uploads/TCG-Glossary-V1.1-Rev-1.0.pdf

comments.author: henkbirkholz
comments.body:
> Protected Capability is defined in: https://trustedcomputinggroup.org/wp-content/uploads/TCG-Glossary-V1.1-Rev-1.0.pdf

Added via PR

comments.author: henkbirkholz
comments.body: split out "final words" and closing this one

issues.title: Yogesh's WGLC review
issues.author: henkbirkholz
issues.body:
Archived-at: https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/rats/6TdPGSakqgrtevbKVo25J0YvdKY

## Nit

In Section 4.6.  Configuring the <attestation> Event Stream:
<tpm2-heartbeat> defines the maximum amount of time which should pass.
I think, the heartbeat is a minimum time not the maximum time, as aligned with other part of the specification.

comments.author: henkbirkholz
comments.body: AFAIU, a heartbeat interval is the upper bound of a timeframe in which you need to receive the heartbeat message or run into a timeout.

comments.author: henkbirkholz
comments.body: All other items seem to be addressed.

issues.title: Add text defining/refering to Verifying Relying Party
issues.author: henkbirkholz
issues.body: The term "Verifying Relying Party" is used in other RATS or SEAT work. Those roles are quite often collapsed in common practice which is captured in RIV (RFC 9683) [Figure 2](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9683.html#figure-2). The term seems to be have introduced via the aTLS work.

comments.author: henkbirkholz
comments.body: This seems to be a bad approach, needlessly convoluting the meaning of RATS roles that are already designed to be composable. The diagrams will retain the "Relying Party / Verifier" composition.

pulls.title: sync with CHARRA and fix too long lines
pulls.author: William-PanWei

comments.body:
```suggestion
This document defines how to subscribe to YANG Event Streams for Remote Attestation Procedures (RATS). In RATS, the Conceptional Messages defined can potentially be subscribed to. Specifically, the YANG module defined in this document augments the YANG module for TPM-based Challenge-Response based Remote Attestation (CHARRA) to allow for subscription to the Conceptual Message type Evidence. Additionally, this memo provides the methods and means to define additional Event Streams for other Conceptual Messages than Evidence as illustrated in the RATS Architecture, e.g., Attestation Results, Endorsements, or Event Logs. The module defined requires at least one TPM 1.2, TPM 2.0, or equivalent hardware implementation providing the same protected capabilities as TPMs to be available in the Attester the YANG server is running on.
```

```suggestion
This specification addresses the first adverse effect by enabling a consumer of Conceptual Messages (the subscriber) to request a continuous stream of new or updated Conceptual Messages via an {{RFC8639}} subscription to an \<attestation\> Event Stream. This new Event Stream is defined in this document and exists upon the producer of Conceptual Messages (the publisher). In the case of a Verifier's subscription to an Attester's Evidence, the Attester will continuously stream a requested set of freshly generated Evidence to the subscribing Verifier. For example, when a network device's Evidence changes after the occurrence of events, such as booting, updating, control unit fall-over, plugging in or out forwarding units, being attacked, or certificate lifetime change, the network device will generate fresh Evidence available to the subscribing Verifier.
```

pulls.title: Updating the Sequence Diagram
pulls.author: henkbirkholz
pulls.body: based on the current state of the reference interaction model for Streaming Remote Attestation without a Broker

reviews.author: thomas-fossati
reviews.body:
Thank you very much, this is great.

I have left a few editorial suggestions inline.

comments.body:
```suggestion
The terms defined in {{!RFC9684}} are mapped to the model described in {{Section 7.3.1 of -rats-models}} (Streaming Remote Attestation without a Broker) to produce the sequence diagram {{newsequence}}.
```

```suggestion
The terminology mapping is as follows:
```

```suggestion
* `claimsSelection` is substituted with `PcrSelection`, an optional "pcr-index" from either the tpm12-challenge-response-attestation RPC or the tpm20-challenge-response-attestation RPC as specified in {{!RFC9684}}. If no PCR is selected, all PCR banks are returned.
```

```suggestion
* `claims` is substituted with `PcrQuotes`, which is the "output" of either the tpm12-challenge-response-attestation RPC or the tpm20-challenge-response-attestation RPC, as specified in {{!RFC9684}}. Unlike event logs, there is no delta to a previous iteration of PCR Quotes during a subscription; all new (selected) Quotes are conveyed as fresh Evidence.
```

```suggestion
* `claims` is substituted with `PcrQuotes`, which is the "output" of either the tpm12-challenge-response-attestation RPC or the tpm20-challenge-response-attestation RPC, as specified in {{!RFC9684}}. Unlike event logs, there is no delta to a previous iteration of PCR Quotes during a subscription; all new (selected) Quotes are conveyed as fresh Evidence.
```

```suggestion
* `eventLogs` represents "system-event-logs" that are in the "output" of the log-retrieval RPC, as defined in {{!RFC9684}}.
```

```suggestion
* `eventLogsDelta` represents "system-event-logs" as specified in the "output" of the log-retrieval RPC as defined in {{!RFC9684}} where the "output" is limited as if the "input" were parameterized via an index type (last-entry, index, timestamp) set to the last event in the previously conveyed `eventLogs`.
```


pulls.title: Rework intro to address comments in #17
pulls.author: thomas-fossati
pulls.body:
This should have included the changes to the abstract that unfortunately [were committed directly on main](https://github.com/ietf-rats-wg/draft-ietf-rats-network-device-subscription/commit/a5987485a9cbc309769c5609b7ec1ec005f29f57) :-(

In #17 I have flagged the specific points that I have addressed.  There are a few still pending which I don’t have the authority or knowledge to resolve.

comments.body:
```suggestion
{{-rats-arch}} defines "Relevant Events over Time" in RATS. The following sequence diagram focusses on matching the defined events with the interactions between the Attester and the Verifying Relying Party. The action of conveying "collectClaims" as defined in {{Section 6 of -rats-models}} is not defined by {{-rats-arch}} and therefore cannot be matched to a specified event time.
```

```suggestion
{{-rats-arch}} defines "Relevant Events over Time" in RATS. The following sequence diagram focusses on matching the defined events with the interactions between the Attester and the Verifying Relying Party. The action of conveying "collectClaims", which is defined in {{Section 6 of -rats-models}}, is not defined by {{-rats-arch}}.   Therefore, it cannot be matched to a specified event time.
```

```suggestion
{{-rats-arch}} defines "Relevant Events over Time" in RATS. The following sequence diagram focusses on matching the defined events with the interactions between the Attester and the Verifying Relying Party.
The action of conveying "collectClaims", which is defined in {{Section 6 of -rats-models}}, is not defined by {{-rats-arch}}.
Therefore, it cannot be matched to a specified event time.
```

pulls.title: Simplfied text about "timing consideration" and "clock drift"
pulls.author: henkbirkholz

comments.body:
```suggestion
Consequently, other conditions arising in different application scenarios ought to be considered in the same way. For example, the time of Claims collection ought to be taken into account.
```

```suggestion
  * and a handle (see {{Section 6 of -rats-models}}), which is either the initially received nonce or a more recently received Epoch ID (see {{Section 10.3 of -rats-arch}}) that contains a new nonce or equivalent qualified data.
```

```suggestion
When the Attester includes a TPM2-compliant cryptoprocessor, internal time-related counters are included within the signed TPM Quote.  By including an initial nonce in the {{RFC8639}} subscription request, fresh values for these counters are pushed as part of the first TPM Quote returned to the Verifier. As shown by {{-TUDA}}, subsequent TPM Quotes delivered to the Verifier can be appraised for freshness based on the predictable incrementing of these time-related counters.
```

```suggestion
To verify the value of a PCR, a Verifier must either know that the value is a "known good" value (see Section 2.3.3 of {{KGV}}) or be able to reconstruct the hash value by viewing all the PCR-Extends since the Attester rebooted. Wherever a hash reconstruction might be needed, the \<attestation\> Event Stream MUST support the RFC8639 \<replay\> feature. Through the \<replay\> feature, it is possible for a Verifier to retrieve and sequentially hash all of the PCR extending events since an Attester booted. And thus, the Verifier has access to all the evidence needed to verify a PCR's current value.
```

pulls.title: Addressing nits from Jun and a few others
pulls.author: henkbirkholz

comments.body:
```suggestion
* `handle` is substituted with `nonce`, a nonce generated by the Verifying Relying Party. This is a nonce-value byte string, obtained from either the tpm12-challenge-response-attestation RPC or the tpm20-challenge-response-attestation RPC, as specified in {{!RFC9684}}. A 'nonce' value in this case is populated out-of-band and can be used more than once in the scope of a subscription (based on local policy that enforces freshness requirements).
```

suggest reflow to eliminate expositional clunkiness


```suggestion
* `handle` is substituted with `nonce`, a nonce generated by the Verifying Relying Party. This is a nonce-value byte string, obtained from either the tpm12-challenge-response-attestation RPC or the tpm20-challenge-response-attestation RPC, as specified in {{!RFC9684}}. In this case, a 'nonce' value is populated out of band and can be used more than once within the scope of a subscription, based on local policies that enforce freshness requirements.
```

```suggestion
* `handle` is substituted with `nonce`, a nonce generated by the Verifier. This is a nonce-value byte string, obtained from either the tpm12-challenge-response-attestation RPC or the tpm20-challenge-response-attestation RPC, as specified in {{!RFC9684}}. Hence, a 'nonce' value in this case is populated out-of-band and can be used more than once in the scope of a subscription (based on local policy that enforces freshness requirements).
```

```suggestion
* `handle` is substituted with `nonce`, a nonce generated by the Verifier. This is a nonce-value byte string, obtained from either the tpm12-challenge-response-attestation RPC or the tpm20-challenge-response-attestation RPC, as specified in {{!RFC9684}}. Hence, in this case, a 'nonce' value is populated out of band and can be used more than once within the scope of a subscription, based on local policies that enforce freshness requirements.
```
